}} A 'convulsion' is a medical condition where body muscles contract and relax
rapidly and repeatedly, resulting in an uncontrolled shaking of the body. [http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/ency/article/000021.htm
Medlineplus medical encyclopedia] Because a convulsion is often a
symptom of an epileptic seizure, the term convulsion is sometimes used as a
synonym for seizure. However, not all epileptic seizures lead to convulsions,
and not all convulsions are caused by epileptic seizures. Convulsions are also
consistent with an electric shock. For non-epileptic convulsions, see non-
epileptic seizures.

The word "fit" is sometimes used to mean a convulsion or epileptic seizure. [http://www.merriam-
webster.com/dictionary/fit%5B3%5D Merriam-Webster: Fit].
